clues.text: The Rotunda, designed by Jefferson
The LBJ Presidential Library

Tribble Hall;
the Demon Deacon statue at Truist Field
Hoover Tower, named after a president
Robert Zemeckis Center for Digital Arts
A computer running in this 4-letter diagnostic "mode" uses a minimum of files to help decipher where a problem might be
This login partner of a password should also be secure; the website nordpass.com can help generate them
An old external modem not communicating fast enough? You may need to increase this measure of speed, bps for short
To "zip" a file is to do this to it, shrink it so that it takes up less memory & can be more easily sent or downloaded
Whenever you access a webpage, your browser puts the data in this temporary storage for faster retrieval
One of Dave Matthews' first big hits was about these little guys "marching, red and black antennae waving"
The Beastie Boys' "Brass" one was actually a cocktail; George Michael sang of a metaphoric one "on your back"
We're not sure of the legality, but Toby Keith had an odd request back in 2002: this drink "For My Horses"
In a song by The Who, Boris is one of these, "black & hairy & very small"
The rapper Desiigner thought a white BMW with tinted windows looked like a certain animal, hence this title of his No. 1 hit
Scouting report on this title guy: very indecisive hitting holes but has great vision--even of his own father's ghost
At QB, she audibles to get her husband to commit murder & win the title but she literally sleepwalks through the 4th quarter
Starting at WR, as no one catches grief better than her, this Lear daughter does get benched from the play in Acts 2 & 3
After a big scramble, this guy "of Athens" retires to the wilderness & coaches Alcibiades on sacking the city
A very outside LB, this guy plays on an island; the son of a witch & a devil, he's a total beast out there!
A noisy outburst by an angry or excited group
Jolly hyphenated exclamation by Grumpy & his housemates on the way home from the mine
This adverb means up until the present moment
Legendary priestess of Aphrodite who left the light on for her lover
From the Spanish for "little oven", it's a mound of molten lava
A wind called a levanter blows through this strait that lies between Spain & Africa
A favorite with boaters, Haro Strait lies between Washington State & this Canadian island that's home to the city of Victoria
This strait at one end of the Persian Gulf carries 1/3 of the world's seaborne oil & was the scene of international tensions in 2019
This strait between mainland South America & Tierra del Fuego links the Atlantic & Pacific Oceans
This long, narrow strait between Malaysia & Sumatra has been a hotbed of piracy in recent years
The Virginia Company was chartered by this king in 1606; he'd later have a New World colony named for him
In 1247 the Priory of St. Mary of Bethlehem, later an asylum known by this 6-letter name, opened in London
This agreement that began in 1955 allowed for Soviet military in constituent countries
In the late 4th century, St. Augustine became bishop of this city of North Africa
When he was broke after editing his "Encyclopedie", Catherine the Great bought his library in 1765 & also gave him a salary
2-word term for unlicensed but legal quoting of copyrighted material in situations like research or news reporting
A plea is entered at this proceeding that is sometimes called an initial hearing
Res judicata, "a thing already judged", is the civil law version of this 2-word action banned by the Bill of Rights
Vanderbilt Law 6090 is the course named for these, covering "liability for intentional harm to person or property"
The first play by lord, novelist, politician & inmate Jeffrey Archer had a legalistic title, "Beyond" these 2 words

Losing the second letter in a word for a sacred Bible hymn gets you this body part
A place of worship sacred to Jews & Mormons alike loses a letter, becoming this Arizona metropolis
A type of holy man loses the last letter of his title & does this, snoops into others' business
A Muslim holy month loses its last letter, becoming this hotel chain
A term for an image or picture of a saint loses its second letter & becomes this really small thing
The name of this quirky alliterative character was inspired by a boomerang toy Roald Dahl had as a boy
Chapters in this work include "The Mock Turtle's Story" & "The Lobster Quadrille"
"Last Sacrifice" was the finale of Richelle Mead's series about special young people attending this school
In a story by Mary Mapes Dodge, the sister of this title boy wins the silver skates
Melinda Sordino is the heroine of this novel by Laurie Halse Anderson; the last name Sordino can mean "mute"
The Jaguar I-PACE & the Fiat 500e are both examples of these, ZEVs for short
This base-2 notation system uses only 2 digits, one & zero
0 K, not to be confused with OK, is also known by this phrase
The bran cereal called this "One" says it provides 65% of your daily value of it
ZIRP is short for this banking "policy" that encourages low-cost credit to companies & individuals

rounds.text: Some say he was shot by Sergeant Boston Corbett, & other believe he killed himself
